# fmt Demos

## Basic Formatting

Format JSONL content and verify it remains valid.

<div class="demo-source">

```jsonl
{"type": "palette", "name": "colors", "colors": {"{_}": "#00000000", "{r}": "#FF0000", "{b}": "#0000FF"}}
{"type": "sprite", "name": "dot", "palette": "colors", "size": [1, 1], "regions": {"r": {"points": [[0,0]]}}}
{"type": "sprite", "name": "square", "palette": "colors", "size": [2, 2], "regions": {"r": {"points": [[0,0],[1,0]]}, "b": {"points": [[0,1],[1,1]]}}}
```

</div>

<div class="demo-container" data-demo="basic">
</div>

## Format Roundtrip

Formatted content parses identically to original.

<div class="demo-source">

```jsonl
{"type": "palette", "name": "colors", "colors": {"{_}": "#00000000", "{r}": "#FF0000", "{b}": "#0000FF"}}
{"type": "sprite", "name": "dot", "palette": "colors", "size": [1, 1], "regions": {"r": {"points": [[0,0]]}}}
{"type": "sprite", "name": "square", "palette": "colors", "size": [2, 2], "regions": {"r": {"points": [[0,0],[1,0]]}, "b": {"points": [[0,1],[1,1]]}}}
```

</div>

<div class="demo-container" data-demo="roundtrip">
</div>
